abstract: Virginia Gov Terry McAuliffe plans to individually sign about 206,000 restoration orders giving ex-felons right to vote after his blanket approval in April was upended by Virginia Supreme Court ruling; his ongoing fight to restore what he calls 'civil rights' in historical swing state ahead of presidential election has been countered at every turn by Republicans who control state legislature.

headline.print_headline: Virginia’s Governor Vows  a Fight for Felons to Vote
headline.main: Virginia Governor Says Fight for Felons’ Voting Rights Is Not Over

snippet: After the State Supreme Court ruled against his blanket order restoring the vote to more than 200,000 ex-felons, Gov. Terry McAuliffe vowed to continue “the struggle for civil rights.”...
lead_paragraph: After the State Supreme Court ruled against his blanket order restoring the vote to more than 200,000 ex-felons, Gov. Terry McAuliffe vowed to continue “the struggle for civil rights.”
